chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Asplund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for Probation by 4:00 PM on December 2, 2014.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with A.J.P. - DOB: 02/06/2003.
Must have no unsupervised contact with juvenile females outside of immediate family.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must undergo a sex offender evaluation.
Sex offender registration requirements to be determined after completion of the sex offender evaluation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven E Asplund

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven E Asplund in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea agreement; 

Joint agreement - Count 1  amended to  940.225(3m).  Defendant pleads Guilty to amended charge
The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.  Victim Impact statement filed.
Argument by Attorney Harrington

Court orders
Withheld sentence
1 year probation - Must sign up by 4 PM on 12-02-2014.

Conditions of probation:
Sex offender evaluation 
Sex offender registration to be decided after the sex offender evaluation.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must have No contact with A.J.P.   dob - 2-06-2003
No unsupervised contact with juvenile females outside of immediate family.
Court costs
Plea hearing on December 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
9/9/14 Letter to Attorney Harrington from Judge Bitney regarding wage assignment.

Defendant Steven E Asplund in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 10:48: Deputy Kari Storberg with the Barron County Sheriff's Department called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 10:53: Cross by Defense. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Must have no contact with AJP dob 2/6/2003 or her residence.
